medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent pulmonary infections, congestive heart failure, and failure to thrive in a 3-month-old infant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began around 3 months of age with recurrent pulmonary infections and progressed to congestive heart failure and failure to thrive. The condition has worsened over time, leading to a machinery murmur detected on examination.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent surgical intervention, including closure of the patent ductus arteriosus and elective subaortic membrane removal; no other past medical conditions mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: Two affected children in the family, signifying a familial occurrence of discrete subaortic stenosis.
